attributes.action: Reduce Sales Tax On LPG Gas For Use In Road Vehicles
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
LPG tracks at approximately 55p a litre less than petrol, therefore as petrol increases it becomes relatively less of a financial incentive to convert to LPG.

The government withdrew the grant to convert to LPG but in order to reduce greenhouse-gases they need to give motorists more incentive to convert to this green fuel.

I propose reducing or abolishing the tax added to this fuel, it is a by-product from producing petrol so if motorists don't use it then it will be burnt off anyway, therefore it's environmental impact is almost neutral.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
